TowerDefense

Class AnimationData

  • java.lang.Object
    • TowerDefense.AnimationData

  • public class AnimationData
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains all of the data required for the engine to use an animation. That way you don't have to keep track of it all in a zillion variables.
    Author:
    Branden Drake, Rachel Horton

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ENGINE_FRAME_RATE

      Constructor.

      float getGameHeightFromImageHeight()
      Gives the height in in-game units that an object using this animation should be in order to take up the exact amount of screen real-estate as the image.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnimationData

        public AnimationData(java.lang.String filename,
                     int imageHeight,
                     int imageWidth,
                     int frameHeight,
                     int frameWidth,
                     int numberOfFrames,
                     int framesPerSecond)
        Constructor. Deal with it.
        Parameters:
        filename - File containing the animation.
        imageHeight - Height of the entire animation file.
        imageWidth - Width of the entire animation file.
        frameHeight - Height of each frame of animation within the file.
        frameWidth - Width of each frame of animation within the file.
        numberOfFrames - Number of animation frames in the file.
        framesPerSecond - Intended framerate of this animation.

    • Method Detail

      • getFramesPerSecond

        public int getFramesPerSecond()
        Returns:
        Intended framerate of this animation.

      • getTicksPerFrame

        public int getTicksPerFrame()
        Returns the best approximation of how many ticks each frame of this animation should be drawn. Each game loop, animations are drawn. Every time this happens, consider it one tick. So, how many game frames in a row should each frame of the animation be drawn? That's the number of ticks this returns.
        Returns:
        The number of ticks each frame of this animation should be drawn.

      • getGameWidthFromImageWidth

        public float getGameWidthFromImageWidth()
        Gives the width in in-game units that an object using this animation should be in order to take up the exact amount of screen real-estate as the image.
        Returns:
        The width.

      • getGameHeightFromImageHeight

        public float getGameHeightFromImageHeight()
        Gives the height in in-game units that an object using this animation should be in order to take up the exact amount of screen real-estate as the image.
        Returns:
        The height.
